intro: Machaerium uribei, commonly known as the Uribé machaerium, is a species of flowering plant in the Leguminosae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and feathery, bipinnate leaves. Its small, clustered flowers are typically pink or red, and it produces elongated, cylindrical pods that contain several seeds. Machaerium uribei is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
